data.meta_description: Renault is a French car manufacturer that has been in business since 1899. Founded by brothers Louis, Marcel, and Fernand Renault, the company has grown to become one of the largest car manufacturers in the world. Renault has a long and storied history, and its cars have been a part of many important moments in automotive history.
data.text:
Renault is a French car manufacturer that has been in business since 1899. Founded by brothers Louis, Marcel, and Fernand Renault, the company has grown to become one of the largest car manufacturers in the world. Renault has a long and storied history, and its cars have been a part of many important moments in automotive history.

In 1899, the Renault brothers founded the Renault Fr√®res company in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. The company initially produced cars for racing, and the brothers quickly gained a reputation for producing reliable and powerful vehicles. In 1902, the company released its first production car, the Renault Type A. This car was a success, and it helped to establish the company as a major player in the automotive industry.

In 1906, the Renault brothers introduced the Renault Voiturette, which was the first mass-produced car in Europe. This car was a huge success, and it helped to establish Renault as a major player in the automotive industry. The Voiturette was also the first car to feature a four-cylinder engine, which was a major innovation at the time.

In 1908, Renault released the Renault AG1, which was the first car to feature a four-speed transmission. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The AG1 was also the first car to feature a self-starter, which was a major innovation at the time.

In 1912, Renault released the Renault Type B, which was the first car to feature a V-type engine. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The Type B was also the first car to feature a four-wheel drive system, which was a major innovation at the time.

In the 1920s, Renault released the Renault NN, which was the first car to feature a six-cylinder engine. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The NN was also the first car to feature a hydraulic braking system, which was a major innovation at the time.

In the 1930s, Renault released the Renault 4CV, which was the first car to feature a front-wheel drive system. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The 4CV was also the first car to feature a unitary body construction, which was a major innovation at the time.

In the 1950s, Renault released the Renault Dauphine, which was the first car to feature a rear-engine design. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The Dauphine was also the first car to feature a monocoque body construction, which was a major innovation at the time.

In the 1960s, Renault released the Renault 8, which was the first car to feature a hatchback design. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The 8 was also the first car to feature a fuel injection system, which was a major innovation at the time.

In the 1970s, Renault released the Renault 5, which was the first car to feature a turbocharged engine. This car was a major success, and it helped to establish Renault as a leader in automotive technology. The 5 was also the first car to feature a catalytic converter, which was a major innovation at the time.

Renault has continued to innovate and produce reliable and powerful cars throughout its history. Today, Renault is one of the largest car manufacturers in the world, and its cars are sold in over 120 countries. Renault has a long and storied history, and its cars have been a part of many important moments in automotive history.
